page.description: Generate a static HTML version of your UX component. Several different files will be generated (e.g. .html, .css, .js, etc.). The collection of files is referred to as a 'fileset'. You must save the component that you want to convert to HTML before you can use this feature.

item.name: Component alias
item.description: Specify an alias for this component. The alias is used to generate the object name for the component at runtime.

item.name: Folder
item.description: Specify the folder where the files should be generated. The files will be generated inside a sub-folder in this folder. If you select the <Webroot> the files will be generated in a folder in your Alpha Anywhere webroot and you will be able to do a Remote Preview on a mobile device or Live Preview in your browser.

item.name: Name
item.description: Specify the name for this fileset. The generated files are placed in a sub-folder with this name inside a specified 'Folder'

item.name: Additional assets to include in Fileset
item.description: Specify the filenames of any additional files in the Web Project that you want to include in the fileset.

item.name: Create application manifest
item.description: Specify if an application manifest file should be created.

item.name: Show manifest
item.description: Specify if the manifest should be shown after it has been created. This will allow you to apply manual edits to the list in the manifest.

item.name: Manifest filter rules
item.description: You can define rules to automatically filter out certain files from the manifest.

item.name: URL Ajax callbacks
item.description: Specify the URL for any ajax callbacks that are made from the page.

item.name: Overwrite without warning
item.description: Specify if the warning should be shown before overwriting

item.name: Upload files to Amazon S3 storage
item.description: You can upload the files in the fileset to a bucket in Amazon S3 storage.

item.name: Storage connection string
item.description: To define a storage connection string go to the 'Tools' menu in the Web Projects Control Panel.

item.name: Sub-folder name in Amazon S3 storage

section.title: Create a static HTML version of a Component.
